Pad Module¶

The pad module provides a simple collaborative painting application. It offers remote mouse-cursor sharing and basic paint functionality, like brush, fill, shape and text. It’s a proof of concept, initially started to show the responsiveness nature of websockets, but can be extended to offer more useful functionality, like offering a collaborative space to create presentations and flowcharts. Lately there has been some interesting development in the field of vector-graphics and html5, getting available within the canvas element through libraries like fabric.js and paper.js. Further development should probably go in that direction. Another useful thing would be a serverside canvas renderer, so the initial image-data can be send(which is faster), instead of only a log of operations.

change_layer_order(client, pad_id, layer_id, to_position)[source]¶

Broadcast that the client has changed the ordening of layers. HWIOS keeps a serverside mirror of these layer-ordening as well.

Parameters:
  • client (Client) – The requesting client
  • pad_id (int) – The pad_id to specify the broadcast pool
  • to_position (int) – The list-position the layer is supposed to go to

draw_brush(client, pad_id, layer_id, params)[source]¶

Broadcast that the client is drawing a brush. Params looks like: [x,y,color,dragging,size,brush_type,delta_time]

Parameters:
  • client (Client) – The requesting client
  • pad_id (int) – The pad_id to specify the broadcast pool
  • layer_id (str) – The id of the layer to draw on
  • params (dict) – The parameters that come with drawing a brush.
